summary:
The Azincourt.
A stunning historically inspired bastard sword with accurate dimensions and great texture detail.
descriptionHtml:
[center][img]https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/100553141/Azincourt%20Images/Presentation.png[/img][img]https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/100553141/Azincourt%20Images/1.png[/img][youtube]7vgB2RWw-yw[/youtube][img]https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/100553141/Azincourt%20Images/2.png[/img][/center][heading][size=5][font=georgia,serif]The Azincourt[/font][/heading][/size]
This sword is named for the battle of Azincourt, October 25, 1415, where the exhausted, sick and starving English army of Henry V was faced by a confident French foe outnumbering them four to one. Forced into battle and against all odds, they defeated the French and slaughtered the flower of French nobility.
 
This sword is a tribute to that stunning conflict and is one type of sword that would have seen service on both sides.
 
Oakeshott describes the Type XV as a strongly tapering, acutely pointed blade of flattened diamond cross-section. The sub-type XVa is often longer and slimmer than the Type XV, but with the primary difference being the longer grip. This type of sword was referred to as an epée bâtarde or \"bastard sword.\" 
 
[heading][size=5][font=georgia,serif]Details:[/font][/size][/heading]
The Azincourt.
A stunning historically inspired bastard sword with accurate dimensions and great texture detail. The sword comes with a scabbard and can only be crafted under the steel section at the skyforge (Steel smithing required). For those of you that have downloaded my previous mod, Glimmer, you can expect the same level detail and elegance on the Azincourt that was first introduced on Glimmer. Again, these textures are 2048x2048 and offer a life like rendition of the weapon. Although, it is worth mentioning that the Azincourt has quite a few dents and bruises, since I wanted to capture what the sword would look like after a battle the likes of the one that took place in 1415. 
 
At the skyforge you will be able to craft a 1-Handed and 2-Handed version of the sword. Both with slightly better stats than the ebony sword and greatsword. Some of you might also notice that both weapons are identical in size, and the reason for this is that the two weapons are essentially the same. If you for some reason notice that the 1-Handed version is stronger than the 2-Handed equivalent, this is because you\'re ingame character is more skilled with 1-Handed weapons.
 
Now get in game and start slashing!

[heading][size=5][font=georgia,serif]Installation:[/font][/size][/heading]
To find out how to install or uninstall \"Azincourt\", a simple google search will do the trick. I do not
include instructions here to maintain a \"small\" mod description. Sorry for the inconvenience.
 
[heading][size=5][font=georgia,serif]Changelog:[/font][/size][/heading]
03.08.2013 - Ver 1.1 - Fixed BloodFX issues, Flipped blade for correct texture positioning
02.08.2013 - Ver 1.0 - Initial Release

 
[heading][size=5][font=georgia,serif]Credits:[/font][/size][/heading]
Thanks to DBterp for fantastic screenshots!
Thanks to Bethesda for creating Skyrim.
Thanks to InsanitySorrow for the ReadMe Generator this ReadMe is based on.
Thanks to Imsumdave for the steel environmental map.

[heading][size=5][font=georgia,serif]Licensing/Legal[/font][/size][/heading]
You must contact me and obtain my permission before re-packaging any part of this mod.
Do not re-host this file on another website.

[heading][size=5][font=georgia,serif]Modders Will[/font][/size][/heading]
If I for some reason dissapear from the nexus, either through a ban or other reasons, I request that all my content on this website gets removed. This is to assure me full control over my own content.
[center][img]https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/100553141/Azincourt%20Images/Thanks%21.png[/img][/center]
author: Elvarheim
